Description: Retrieve relevant knowledge from long-term memory.
Example: Identify the parts of the human cell.

Description: Construct meaning from instructional messages, including oral, written, and graphic communication.
Carry out or use a procedure in a given situation.
Example: Calculate the area of a square.

Description: Break material into its constituent parts and determine how the parts relate to one another and to an overall structure or purpose.
Example: Analyze the the impact of heredity versus environment on the expression of complex traits.

Description: Make judgments based on criteria and standards.
Example: Evaluate the quality of a contextualized argument.

Description: Put elements together to form a coherent or functional whole; reorganize elements into a new pattern or structure.
Example: Devise a personalized treatment plan for a patient.

Description: The basic elements students must know to be acquainted with a discipline or solve problems in it.
Example: Identify the parts of the human cell.

Description: The interrelationships among the basic elements within a larger structure that enable them to function together.
Example: Analyze the the impact of heredity versus environment on the expression of complex traits.

Description: How to do something, methods of inquiry, and criteria for using skills, algorithms, techniques, and methods.
Example: Calculate the area of a square.

Description: Knowledge of cognition in general as well as awareness and knowledge of oneâ€™s own cognition.
